record.description: Tri-Cities students speak. Russ Parsons (left) and Bud Linden help Marjorie Kuh practice her speech that [was delivered] Saturday, October 21 before seventy-five key members from all parts of the country of the newly launched University of Chicago Alumni Foundation. They were among six students who described phases of undergraduate life: Parsons spoke about athletics, Miss Kuh on Social life, and Linden on dramatics. Held in the Oriental Institute's Breasted hall, the meeting launched the Alumni Foundation, part of the university's plans for its fiftieth anniversary celebration in 1941.
record.publisher: University of Chicago Library, Special Collections Research Center
